agents.when_to_use: Define Scope - use to clearly outline what needs to be built with a Product Requirement Document (PRD)

agents.goal: Convert PRDs into development task lists
agents.when_to_use: Detailed Planning - use to break down the PRD into a granular, actionable task list

agents.goal: Execute task lists with sequential commits
agents.when_to_use: Iterative Implementation - use to guide the AI to tackle one task at a time, allowing you to review and approve each change
Use for code implementation, debugging, refactoring, optimization, and development best practices

agents.goal: Initialize or update project context documentation
agents.when_to_use: Use to initialize Claude Code context for new/existing projects, discover and organize documentation, create CLAUDE.md and KNOWLEDGE_BASE.md for optimal token-efficient memory

agents.goal: Epics, user stories, prioritization, backlog management
agents.when_to_use: Use for creating epics and user stories, prioritization, backlog navigation, story refinement, and sprint planning
Use for market research, brainstorming, competitive analysis, project briefs, and initial project discovery

agents.goal: Route to agents, execute workflows, discover resources
agents.when_to_use: Use for workflow coordination, multi-agent tasks, role switching, and when unsure which specialist to consult

agents.goal: Code quality validation, test architecture, security review
agents.when_to_use: Use for code review, test coverage analysis, security scanning, quality gate decisions, and improvement recommendations

agents.goal: Design MVP-first architectures with opensource preference
agents.when_to_use: Use for system design, HLA/HLD creation, technology selection, and architecture validation from epics, user stories, or PRDs

agents.goal: Design lightweight, functional UI with simplified flows
agents.when_to_use: Use for UI/UX design, user journeys, low-fidelity mockups, flow simplification, and framework selection
